detaileddescription.para: id of the message
id of the channel the message was sent in
Optional: id of the guild the message was sent in
the author of this message (not guaranteed to be a valid user)
Optional: member properties for this message's author
contents of the message
message components
when this message was sent
when this message was edited (may be 0 if never edited)
whether this was a TTS message
whether this message mentions everyone
users specifically mentioned in the message
roles specifically mentioned in this message (only IDs currently)

Channels mentioned in the message. (Discord: not all types supported) Discord: Only textual channels that are visible to everyone in a lurkable guild will ever be included. Only crossposted messages (via Channel Following) currently include mention_channels at all. (includes ID, Guild ID, Type, Name)
any attached files
zero or more dpp::embed objects
Optional: reactions to the message
Optional: used for validating a message was sent
whether this message is pinned
Optional: if the message is generated by a webhook, its id will be here otherwise the field will be 0
Flags
Stickers
Name of file to upload (for use server-side in discord's url)
File content to upload (raw binary)
Message type
Self allocated user for caching being off

briefdescription.para: The cluster which created this message object.

parameterdescription.para: Owning cluster, passed down to various things such as dpp::attachment. Owning cluster is optional (can be nullptr) and if nulled, will prevent some functions such as attachment::download from functioning (they will throw, if used)

briefdescription.para: Construct a new message object with a channel and content.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to send the message to

briefdescription.para: Construct a new message object with a channel and content.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to send the message to

briefdescription.para: Construct a new message object with content.
Set the original message reference for replies/crossposts.

parameterdescription.para: true if the message send should fail if these values are invalid (optional)

memberdef.argsstring: (bool _parse_users, bool _parse_roles, bool _parse_everyone, bool _replied_user, const std::vector< snowflake > &users, const std::vector< snowflake > &roles)
memberdef.name: set_allowed_mentions

briefdescription.para: Set the allowed mentions object for pings on the message.

parameterdescription.para: whether or not to parse users in the message content or embeds
whether or not to parse roles in the message content or embeds
whether or not to parse everyone/here in the message content or embeds
if set to true and this is a reply, then ping the user we reply to
list of user ids to allow pings for
list of role ids to allow pings for

detaileddescription.para:
Fill this object from json.
j
JSON object to fill from
cp
Cache policy for user records, whether or not we cache users when a message is received
A reference to self

Build JSON from this object.
with_id
True if the ID is to be included in the built JSON
is_interaction_response
Set to true if this message is intended to be included in an interaction response. This will exclude some fields that are not valid in interactions at this time.
The JSON text of the message

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the message was crossposted to other servers.
Returns true if posted from other servers news channel via webhook.

simplesect.para: true if posted from other server

briefdescription.para: True if embeds have been removed.
True if source message was deleted.
True if ephemeral (visible only to issuer of a slash command)

parameterdescription.para: raw file content contained in std::string

briefdescription.para: Represents messages sent and received on Discord.
